It is characterized by its delicate, pleated leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale pink flowers, which are followed by red or orange berries. Lindsaea plicata is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in forest canopies. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
